thread.title: LinkedIn’s stock tumble, slow growth don’t scare analysts - MarketWatch
thread.title_full: LinkedIn’s stock tumble, slow growth don’t scare analysts - MarketWatch

author: By     Kathleen Burke
title: LinkedIn’s stock tumble, slow growth don’t scare analysts - MarketWatch
text:
Talent Solutions product sales were strong in the second quarter, despite unique visitors stagnating at 97 million and revenue from display ads slumping 30% year over year.
Raymond James analyst Justin Patterson said the company’s growth in sponsored content and lead accelerator was enough to offset the losses from display ads.
“With a product cycle in Talent, high [return on investment] ad units, and a growth engine in Sales Navigator, we see potential upside to our above consensus 2016…estimates,” Patterson said. The Sales Navigator tool aims to help users target prospects for sales pitches.
Raymond James reiterated its strong buy rating and raised its price target to $271 from $262.
Though analysts at Sterne Agee CRT were positive on LinkedIn’s growth, the lack of momentum in its primary business remained a concern. They reiterated their neutral rating.
“[Second quarter] results were better-than-expected but full year guidance for the core business was lowered slightly,” CRT analyst Arvind Bhatia wrote in a note to investors. “Management attributed this to continued pressure and limited visibility on the display business.”
